def pivot_table(
    data,
    values=None,
    index=None,
    columns=None,
    aggfunc="mean",
    fill_value=None,
    margins=False,
    dropna=True,
    margins_name="All",
    observed=False,
) -> "DataFrame":
    # Existing code...

    keys = index + columns

    grouped = data.groupby(keys, observed=observed)
    agged = grouped.agg(aggfunc)

    # Correcting the handling of multi-index columns
    if agged.columns.nlevels > 1:
        # Unstack the multi-index columns
        table = agged.unstack()

        # Dropping any empty columns if dropna=True
        if dropna:
            table = table.dropna(axis=1, how="all")

    # Existing code...

    if margins:
        if dropna:
            data = data[data.notna().all(axis=1)]
        table = _add_margins(
            table,
            data,
            values,
            rows=index,
            cols=columns,
            aggfunc=aggfunc,
            observed=dropna,
            margins_name=margins_name,
            fill_value=fill_value,
        )

    # Existing code...

    return table
